project.teaser: Breast cancer (BC) is the most common cancer in women worldwide, affecting 1 in 8 women. The figures from WHO’s International Agency for Research on Cancer estimate that in 2020 worldwide cases of breast cancer accounted for 24% of all cancers in women (2.26 million women...
project.objective: Breast cancer (BC) is the most common cancer in women worldwide, affecting 1 in 8 women. The figures from WHO’s International Agency for Research on Cancer estimate that in 2020 worldwide cases of breast cancer accounted for 24% of all cancers in women (2.26 million women and 685,000 deaths globally). Mammography is the gold standard technology for breast screening, which has been demonstrated through different randomized controlled trials to reduce breast cancer mortality. However, it has limitations and potential harms, such as the use of ionizing radiation, breast compression and performance restrictions due to the intrinsic nature of X-rays. In particular, breast density is a restrictive property that can prevent breast cancer detection in mammograms of women with radiographically dense breasts. Other existing techniques (MRI, Ultrasound, biopsy) also suffer from drawbacks. The overall aim of the MammoScreen proposal is to generate evidence about the use of MammoWave (a technology developed by UBT) as screening technique in population-based programs promoted by National or Regional Health Systems, to reach a revolution in breast screening. To do so, the consortium aims to confirm that MammoWave reaches sensitivity>90% and specificity>95% in BC detection on 10000 study participants undergoing regular screening programs. MammoWave uses safe non-invasive and non-ionizing microwave signals, does not apply any compression to the breast and is very effective with dense breasts. Hence it can extend the breast screening to younger women aged 20-49 (98 million women in Europe). This group accounts for ~30% of breast cancers in 2020. A comprehensive health economic assessment will be undertaken in this project and innovative way to implement patient engagement approaches is sought. An effective policy makers’ engagement plan will be carried out to ensure that MammoWave is recommended as screening approach due to the benefits that it brings to women and healthcare systems. This action is part of the Cancer Mission cluster of projects on ‘Prevention, including Screening.
project.title: Innovative and safe microwave-based imaging technology to make breast cancer screening more accurate, inclusive and female-friendly
project.keywords: Breast Cancer Screening, Microwave Technology, Quality of Life

result.title: Workshops with clinicians' report
result.description: This deliverable summarises the outcomes of the task 5.2, which aims to share the feedback from patients on their design requirements and to ensure that clinical portal and patient facing app captures everything that clinical teams will require to support their work and ensure that the overall system is efficient and effective, as well as being patient centric

result.title: DEC plan
result.description: The report will include the comprehensive Dissemination, Explotation and Communicaion startegy and plan, with focuses on each organisationa, timelines ecc.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - MammoScreen (Innovative and safe microwave-based imaging technology to make breast cancer screening more accurate, inclusive and female-friendly)
result.teaser: Breast cancer is the most common cancer in women: 1 in 11 women is affected by age 74 . Mammography-based screening programmes show strong performance but present drawbacks, such as the uses of x-rays and low efficacy in dense breasts. There's a demand for more inclusive...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

webItem.alternativeText: The Consortium members during the annual in person meeting in Lisbon,May 2024

result.title: Data Management Plan (DMP)
result.description: The Data Management Plan will be a comprehensive document which explains how the data collected, methodology, storage and accessibility. It will be developed in synergy with the other project coordinators of the Prevention cluster within the mission cancer.The preparation of the Data Management Plan will include a common chapter on the ‘Prevention, including Screening’ cluster. The aim is of the chapter is to address commonalities in data standards, data validation, data protection and foster data exchange.

result.title: Initial work plan for the Mission cluster prevention projects
result.description: This delicverable will provide an Initial common work plan for scientific collaboration under the ‘Prevention, including Screening’ cluster for all the projects.

result.title: Appointment of the Data and Ethics advisory board
result.description: The report will contain the nomination of the experts for the Data and Ethcs Advisory Board, the methodology of selection as well as the ones that have been selected. Gender inclusivity balance will be guaranteed

result.title: Establishment of the Scientific Advisory Board
result.description: The report will contain the nomination of the experts for the Advisory Board, as well as the ones that have been selected. Gender inclusivity balance will be guaranteed

result.title: Study initiation package
result.description: Study initiation package, containing the final version of the study protocol as submitted to regulators, a registration number of the CT in a WHO or ICMJE-approved registry and approvals from the ethics committee and national competent authority

result.title: Batch production of MammoWave devices
result.description: As MammoWave devices will be produced and located in the hospitals enrolling hospitals, a report will be produced with the production costs, the final location of the device and the training provided to the health workforce of the hospitals involved.

result.title: Patient workshops Report
result.description: The report will summarise the outcomes of the Task 5.1which aims to ensure that patients are involved and engaged in the design of the digital interface, from the outset, which will support patient journeys.

result.title: Project website
result.description: The report will summarise all the process to develop the project website, it's branding strategy as well as the positioning compared to other similar initiatives. Administrative information (about the developer chosen, the offers received and the methodology to chose the final provider) will be also included.

result.title: Annual Cluster meeting report 1
result.description: This deliverable will contain the Conclusions of common annual meeting of the ‘Prevention, including Screening’ cluster within the Mission Cancer, as well as Policy brief formulating recommendations based on the research and innovation strand of the ‘Prevention, including Screening’ annual cluster meeting

result.title: Patient-facing app built
result.description: This task summarised the activities carried out to develop tpatient-facing app (task 5.4).

result.title: Integrating clinical research in an operative screening and diagnostic breast imaging department: First experience, results and perspectives using microwave imaging

details.authors: Daniel Álvarez Sánchez-Bayuela; Rubén Giovanetti González; Paul Martín Aguilar Angulo; Lina Marcela Cruz Hernández; María del Pilar Sánchez-Camacho González-Carrato; Ana Rodríguez Sánchez; Gianluigi Tiberi; Cristina Romero Castellano

result.title: Systematic review of HTA results for BC screening in Europe
result.description: as outcome of the Task 6.1 this deliverable collects HTA evidence about the cost-effectiveness of different screening protocols in Europe.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
